title.narrative: Support for provision of emergency critical lifesaving WASH interventions for South Sudanese refugees

description.narrative: Assessments conducted by WHO and UNCIEF show that the refugees from South Sudan are facing severe shortages of water. Current water sources include (unchlorinated) river and canal water which is being shared with animals. WHO proposes to provide safe access to water for South Sudanese refugees in the White Nile and South Kordofan States through water testing and monitoring water sources in the refugee relocation sites as well as in the host communities. WHO will procure water testing kits to rapidly conduct water quality testing. WHO will simultaneously provide training for environmental health workers and community volunteers on proper water chlorination and water cleanliness and safety.
